ygData.subject: RE: (OT) Lower level discrimination was Play Time?
ygData.msgSnippet: I doubt it will change.  More likely I will still be complaining about overcrowding at the higher levels, much as I am now.  The only time I thought there
ygData.messageBody:
I doubt it will change. More likely I will still be complaining about
overcrowding at the higher levels, much as I am now. The only time I
thought there wasn't overcrowding was at levels 12-15 when I was in Paw.
That place was Empty with a capital E! So was Kerra Isle. Once they no
longer provided useful xp I found myself running into zones with 100+ people
again. Even 45 people in Najena is way too many, that zone is tiny! 143 in
E Karana was pretty pointless too, unless you just wanted to travel. I have
no doubt that the higher levels suffer from overcrowding, but I think its
just as prevalent at lower levels. 'sides we all know you're not a
powergamer Harm, else you'd have solo'd Naggy as many times as Rokenn by
now...

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Monday, January 31, 2000 7:35 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] (OT) Lower level discrimination was Play Time?


From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>


I wanted to answer this, and quote things from the message
but I haven't the energy. I'll tell you this much:

I made level 50 after 9 months, Verant suggested it would take 12
months to make level 50. I guess I'm smarter than the average
bard. But clumping me in the powergamers cliq is your own false
take on this. If you're looking for someone to blame, don't look
this way.

All I can tell you right now is your tune will change. Mine did.

Harmonic.
